problem_text: If m \angle AFE = 14x+8 and m \angle BFC = 8x-15, find the value of x so that \angle AFC is a right angle.
proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: ∠KFH, ∠IFB, ∠IFH, ∠CFH, ∠DFB, pi * ((8 + 14 * x) / 180) = ∠AFE, ∠DFH, ∠BFD, B on FH, F on AD, DF ⊥ FI, pi * ((8 * x - 15) / 180) = ∠CFB, ∠IFA, F on BE, AF ⊥ CF, C on FI, D on FK, ∠DFI, 3.14 = pi

Step 2:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠DFB
Conclusions: ∠DFB = 2 * pi - ∠BFD

Step 3:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠DFH, B on FH
Conclusions: ∠DFB = ∠DFH

Step 4:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : B on FH, ∠CFH
Conclusions: ∠CFB = ∠CFH

Step 5:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : B on FH, ∠IFH
Conclusions: ∠IFB = ∠IFH

Step 6:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : DF ⊥ FI
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠DFI

Step 7:
Theorem: Vertical Angle Theorem
Premises : F on AD, F on BE
Conclusions: ∠AFE = ∠DFB

Step 8:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : AF ⊥ CF
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠CFA

Step 9:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠IFH, C on FI
Conclusions: ∠CFH = ∠IFH

Step 10:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : C on FI, ∠IFA
Conclusions: ∠CFA = ∠IFA

Step 11:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠KFH, D on FK
Conclusions: ∠DFH = ∠KFH

Step 12:
Theorem: Straight Angle
Premises : ∠DFI, ∠IFA
Conclusions: pi = ∠DFI + ∠IFA

Step 13:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠DFI, ∠IFB, ∠BFD
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠BFD + ∠DFI + ∠IFB

Step 14:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((8 * x - 15) / 180) = ∠CFB, ∠CFB = ∠CFH, ∠CFH = ∠IFH
Conclusions: pi * ((8 * x - 15) / 180) = ∠IFH

Step 15:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CFA = ∠IFA, pi / 2 = ∠CFA, pi / 2 = ∠DFI
Conclusions: ∠DFI = ∠IFA

Step 16:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DFB = ∠DFH, ∠DFH = ∠KFH
Conclusions: ∠DFB = ∠KFH

Step 17:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi = ∠DFI + ∠IFA
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠DFI + ∠IFA

Step 18:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((8 * x - 15) / 180) = ∠IFH, ∠IFB = ∠IFH
Conclusions: pi * ((8 * x - 15) / 180) = ∠IFB

Step 19:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((8 * x - 15) / 180) = ∠IFH, ∠CFH = ∠IFH
Conclusions: pi * ((8 * x - 15) / 180) = ∠CFH

Step 20:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DFB = ∠KFH, pi * ((8 + 14 * x) / 180) = ∠AFE, ∠AFE = ∠DFB
Conclusions: pi * ((8 + 14 * x) / 180) = ∠KFH

Step 21:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : pi * ((8 * x - 15) / 180) = ∠CFH, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((8 * x - 15) / 180) = ∠CFH

Step 22:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DFB = ∠KFH, pi * ((8 + 14 * x) / 180) = ∠KFH
Conclusions: pi * ((8 + 14 * x) / 180) = ∠DFB

Step 23:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((8 * x - 15) / 180) = ∠CFH, 3.14 * ((8 * x - 15) / 180) = ∠CFH
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((8 * x - 15) / 180) = pi * ((8 * x - 15) / 180)

Step 24:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi * ((8 + 14 * x) / 180) = ∠DFB
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((8 + 14 * x) / 180) = ∠DFB

Step 25:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 * ((8 * x - 15) / 180) = pi * ((8 * x - 15) / 180), pi * ((8 * x - 15) / 180) = ∠IFB
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((8 * x - 15) / 180) = ∠IFB

Step 26:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 * ((8 + 14 * x) / 180) = ∠DFB, ∠DFB = 2 * pi - ∠BFD
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((8 + 14 * x) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠BFD

Step 27:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : ∠DFI = ∠IFA, 3.14 * ((8 * x - 15) / 180) = ∠IFB, 3.14 = ∠DFI + ∠IFA, 3.14 * ((8 + 14 * x) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠BFD, 2 * pi = ∠BFD + ∠DFI + ∠IFB
Conclusions: 11.17 = x
logic_fomrs_refined: Equals(MeasureOf(Angle(A, F, E)), Mul(pi, Div(Add(Mul(14.0, x), 8.0), 180.0)))
Equals(MeasureOf(Angle(C, F, B)), Mul(pi, Div(Sub(Mul(8.0, x), 15.0), 180.0)))
